On Fri, Sep 28, 2012 at 12:59 PM, Ruben Verborgh
<ruben.verborgh@...> =
wrote:
>>> but we can't expect clients to navigate to the desired resource =
every time again, can we?
>>
>> yes, why not?
>
> a) efficiency

This is ex=
actly why we have (private) caching. You can traverse over
resources withou=
t actually hitting the network.

> b) what would such as navigation path lo=
ok like?
> 1. start with known resource
> 2. follow hypermedia links
> 3. e=
nd at desired resource
> Works really well=85 until the resource whose URI =
changed is not in step 3, but step 1.

Hence why we have 'entry points' whi=
ch /are/ the stable URIs of a
hypermedia application. This is what distingu=
ishes them as an entry
point - they are an resource a client can assume exi=
sts (i.e.
bookmark). If every URI in your app was supposed to be bookmarkab=
le
then the term 'entry point' would be meaningless.

Cheers,
M
